trans-unit.target: TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_000<tab>Oh, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, how fare you? Still fighting the good fight, I shouldn't doubt, and bringing succor to all those in need.

TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_010<tab>Oh, 'tis you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! I recently had the pleasure of meeting my alumna Alisaie, who told me about all your exploits. Suffice it to say I was shocked to learn that I had a storied hero assisting me on my maiden mission...
TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you ask?
TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_A1_000_001<tab>How fare you of late?
TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_A1_000_002<tab>What is a sage?
TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_A1_000_003<tab>What are your thoughts on the diary?
TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_A1_000_004<tab>Nothing.

TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_020<tab>All is well thanks to you and your invaluable aid. Guildivain has been sent back to Sharlayan, where he will be tried by the Forum, and I've no doubt but that he will get his just deserts.

TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_021<tab>Meanwhile, I will stay in Eorzea for a time to broaden my horizons, with a view to eventually train as a healer like my mother. And when I set out on that path, I shall have to ask you for some advice on spellcraft!

TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_022<tab>As for Loifa and his fellows, they still seek a cure for the procedure's side effects. You might run into them at the Hard Place─when not hard at work, they sometimes take a moment there to relax and unwind.

TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_023<tab>Loifa is down after a few tankards while Mahaud tosses them back as if it were water. Ancel tends to lose a little too much inhibition and occasionally has to be restrained by the proprietor. In other words, they are like any other group of young folk, and it warms my heart to see this.
TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_030<tab>Oh? I thought you were already familiar with the subject. Not that I mind reviewing it, of course, and perhaps I had omitted some details previously.

TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_031<tab>To begin at the beginning, our revered ancestor Nyunkrepf advocated the betterment of mankind. And 'twas in accordance with this tenet that somanoutics, the sage's art, was created by combining the wisdom of medicine, aetherology, and sorcery.

TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_032<tab>Through medicine, a sage grasps the workings of the flesh; through aetherology, <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> unlocks the secrets of the soul; and finally, through sorcery, <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> learns to manipulate the two.

TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_033<tab>In order to channel <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> powers, a sage employs a set of four short staves called nouliths. These instruments have their origins in adder stones, naturally occurring objects of power which harbor spiritual energy.
TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_034<tab>Used by healers of eld, these stones were placed around the sick and ailing to create an aetheric confluence that would aid in their art.

TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_035<tab>While nouliths are far more sophisticated, the basic principle remains unchanged. Wielding them as an extension of <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> mind, a sage sends them darting through the air to unleash <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> magicks.

TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_040<tab>By your asking this, I assume you have also read the diary to the end. I have dispelled the obfuscation enchantment in its entirety, and there are no further entries.
TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_041<tab>Judging from the contents, it belonged to Guildivain's wife. But where the handwriting changes, it would appear he took over.

TEXT_JOBDEFGFF2_00730_LALAHJINJAHL_000_042<tab>I, of course, have other thoughts on the matter, but I am not yet sure how to put them into words. For now, however, I will say this: I am glad that it was you who inherited Hatia's legacy. Quite glad...
